intro: Tapeinotes carolinae, commonly known as the Carolina lichen, is a species of lichen that exhibits unique botanical characteristics. It belongs to the family Pilocarpaceae and is composed of a symbiotic association between a fungus and a green alga. The thallus of Tapeinotes carolinae is typically foliose, with a leathery texture and a dark green to blackish color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on decaying wood or rock surfaces. This lichen is of particular interest in ecological studies due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
